paper_title: S-scheme heterojunction based on p-type ZnMn2O4 and n-type ZnO with improved photocatalytic CO2 reduction activity

catalyst.source: In the present paper, hierarchical ZnMn 2 O 4 /ZnO nanofibers were prepared as photocatalysts by electrospinning and calcination.
catalyst.context: Inspired by the carbon cycle in nature, it is promising to convert CO 2 into energy-dense hydrocarbon fuels via photocatalytic CO 2 reduction.In the present paper, hierarchical ZnMn 2 O 4 /ZnO nanofibers were prepared as photocatalysts by electrospinning and calcination.They outperformed pristine ZnO nanofibers with about 4-fold increment in CO and CH 4 yields.Except for the advantages coming from the design, such as more exposed active sites and multiple light reflections, other benefits derived from interface charge transfer are also important.To uncover this, density functional theory calculation (DFT), along with X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy (XPS) was performed.Photoluminescence (PL) and time-resolved PL spectroscopy revealed that the charge separation efficiency in the composite was significantly elevated.Step-scheme (S-scheme) charge transfer was testified in the composite.This result, for the first time, exemplifies that S-scheme charge-transfer can also be realized in heterojunction based-on p-type ZnMn 2 O 4 and n-type ZnO.It provides a new insight into the design of other Sscheme photocatalysts, which are composed of p-type and n-type semiconductors.

ZnO/ZnMn 2 O 4 composite was obtained by electrospinning and hightemperature calcination.Concrete steps can be found in the Supporting Information.The content of ZnMn 2 O 4 in different samples can be adjusted by the amount of manganese acetate in the precursors.When the weight percentage of manganese acetate is 5, 30 and 50, the prepared samples were designated as ZZM5, ZZM30 and ZZM50, respectively.Besides, pristine ZnO and ZnMn 2 O 4 were named as Z and ZM, respectively. The preparation process of pristine ZnO nanofibers was similar to the above process.Except that manganese acetate was excluded in the precursor, other experimental process was the same as that of composite nanofibers. Characterization techniques and performance evaluation are provided in the Supporting Information.

catalyst.context: In summary, a kind of novel composite based on ZnMn 2 O 4 /ZnO nanofibers was successfully synthesized via electrospinning and hightemperature calcination.Its photocatalytic CO 2 reduction performance was remarkably enhanced.The enhancement of activity is owing to boosted visible light utilization, low interface charge transfer resistance, abundant reactive sites and optimized charge transport pathway offered by S-scheme heterojunction.XPS and DFT results further confirmed the existence of S-scheme charge transfer.This is also the first time that Sscheme comprised of a p-type and n-type semiconductors has been found and proved experimentally as well as theoretically.The current work paves the way for the design and preparation of S-scheme photocatalysts based on p-type and n-type semiconductors.
